intro: Acantholimon hypochoerum, commonly known as the narrowleaf flaxvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, hard-coated seeds that are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas effectively. This species is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and disturbed soils.
